1124504913768329216.text: 70%+ of DNS noise can be eliminated by excluding the top 100 queries. Before releasing a configuration, I'm ensuring any domains excluded are properly secured with HSTS or other mitigations, and that no arbitrary subdomain content is hosted on them. This will take a bit.

1124504262552313856.text: Additionally, DNS events have RESPONSE LOGGING! Query and Response are in the SAME EVENT. This MASSIVELY reduces event volume. If no response is logged, a status code is set as well.

Sensors will know anomalies and actively push them to the cloud for analysis.
Additionally, they will analyze and extra smaller datasets like faces.
At the same time, they will record locally in an indexable way, for retrieval later. 1TB memory is the size of fingernail in 2019.

1119755672663527424.text:
This is called Edge Computing, and Azure/AWS already have the frameworks for these systems where you control it in the cloud, but push the logic to the systems in the field.
Data Centers are expensive. Pushing power/heat/non-redundancy to massive external fleets is attractive.

1119754195639443463.text:
Then you add in image analysis and machine learning for anomalies.
The future gov/corp surveillance state is not a giant command center of thousands of screens, with people watching cameras.

The cameras are going to watch themselves.

1119754192934113280.text:
Although 5G will dramatically increase wireless bandwidth, the number of sensors will increase faster.
At the same time, smartphones have made previously supercomputer-level compute into cheap SOC packages. Which are cheaper to program for/maintain than dedicated physical logic.

1119754188160929792.text: There is a revolution that’s going to occur that our current paradigm disguises. The cloud is not going to be the sole center of processing. More and more logic is going to be pushed to the edge. To the sensors. Here’s why.
